subject: Enhancing Safety of Road Users in Foggy Weather
text: HRh 7 TTHNfgiferazrut (Tsw rRdev er rTHrf #FR, HRG FRTFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) ama T 0i-5 & 6, F4er-10, ERq; 7f fcrlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAII Policy Guidelines/ Road Safetyl 2024 Policy Circular No. 12.35/ 2024 dated 27th November , 2024 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/ Roadsafetyissues /misc/2023 (Comp. No. 229461)} (In Supersession of earlier Policy Circular No.12.34/2024 dated O3rd January, 2024) Sub: Enhancing Safety of Road Users in Weather reg: In the Winter Season due to Foggy Conditions, there is reduced visibility experienced on Highways. This situation poses a significant risk to Road Users particularly during the night time, leading to potential accidents and endangering the safety of Road Users. In order to improve the visibility and enhancing the safety of Road Users, all field units are directed to undertake following mitigation measures: As Engineering Measures: is Rectify the faded or inadequate pavement markings such as Edge Lane Chevron markings, Zebra markings etc ji. Enhance visibility of road safety devices viz. MBCB/ RCC barrier by providing reflective markers, fixing retro reflective yellow sticker 50 mm x 50 mm on each post of mettle beam safety barrier etc. jii. Provide Roadway Delineators confirming to clause 3 of IRC-79, 2019. iv. Fix Median Markers as per section 4 of IRC 2019 on medians and RCC Barriers 2m distance in case of urban areas and Sm distance in case of rural section of Highways and Expressways. V Provide Transverse bar markings with could applied plastics of thickness Smm and 10 mm in Habitations area and accident prone locations as per IRC 35. vi. Highway lighting wherever installed shall be made operational and light shall be switch on early as per the weather conditions. vii. Provide solar Blinkers on Median openings. viii. Provide Inos. High Mast lighting of 25m height on median openings confirming to Policy Circular 11.54 dated 30.10.2023. ix. Provide Zebra markings on all Median Openings and road studs on zebra marking confirming to clause: 9.5 of IRC: SP-84/87 X. Replacement of damaged /missing Hazard Object Hazard Markers signs at diverging & merging locations, Road Side Hazards, Culverts, Toll plaza etc. xi. Provide missing/ damaged road signs including Chevron signs o curves as per IRC 67 2022_ xii. To enhance the visibility, replace damaged /missing road studs along edge lines and center line on curves, entry/exit ramps, slip roads of intersections, Zebra markings etc_ confirming to table 9.1 of IRC SP 87/84 2019.
